intro: Morisia monanthos, commonly known as the single-flowered morisia, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a woody stem with narrow, grass-like leaves. Morisia monanthos is known for its ability to thrive in sandy soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation. Its flowers bloom in spring and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
